main_definition: To let go of or set free, either physically, mentally, or metaphorically.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In the context of physical objects, such as chemicals or substances, to allow them to flow out of a container or system.
meanings_and_examples.example: The company released the new product into the market.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To publish information, particularly in written form, often after an official investigation or review process has been completed.
meanings_and_examples.example: A documentary release includes interviews with experts and firsthand accounts of the event it covers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In filmmaking, to make a movie available for public viewing after production is complete.
meanings_and_examples.example: The much-anticipated blockbuster was released in cinemas worldwide last weekend.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To relinquish control or responsibility over something, often after an effort to manage or contain it has been made.
meanings_and_examples.example: After several weeks of planning and organizing the event, she finally released herself from its management responsibilities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In technology, to make software available for use after updates or fixes have been applied.
meanings_and_examples.example: The latest update was released today, allowing users to enjoy new features and improvements on their devices.
